                    "221901", "221909", "222", "2221", "22210", "222100", "2222", "22220", "222200",
                    "2223", "22230", "222309", "2229", "22290", "222901", "222902", "222909"]
    df.loc[(df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(rubber_codes)) & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [17, "17 â€“ Rubber and plastic"]
    
    paper_codes = ["17", "171", "1712", "17120", "171200", "172", "1721", "17210", "172100", "1729",
                   "17290", "172900", "1711", "17110", "171100", "1722", "17220", "172200", "1723", "17230",
                   "172301", "172309", "1724", "17240", "172400"]
    df.loc[(df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(paper_codes)) & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [18, "18 â€“ Paper and packaging"]
    
    # --- Consolidated sectors (settore_1) ---
    df['settore_1'] = df['settore'].copy()
    df['scheda_1'] = df['scheda'].copy()
    
    df.loc[df['settore'].isin([3.1, 7.1]), ['settore_1', 'scheda_1']] = [371, "371 â€“ Textile and clothing"]
    df.loc[df['settore'].isin([3.2, 7.2]), ['settore_1', 'scheda_1']] = [372, "372 â€“ Pharmaceutics"]
    df.loc[df['settore'].isin([3.3, 7.3]), ['settore_1', 'scheda_1']] = [373, "373 â€“ Automotive"]
    df.loc[df['settore'].isin([3.4, 7.4]), ['settore_1', 'scheda_1']] = [374, "374 â€“ Food and beverage"]
    df.loc[df['settore'].isin([3.5, 7.5]), ['settore_1', 'scheda_1']] = [375, "375 â€“ Fuel"]
    
    # --- Final override for cooperatives ---
    cooperatives_codes = ['CR', 'SG', 'OS', 'CF', 'PC', 'PS', 'OO', 'SC', 'CS', 'AE', 'SO', 'OC', 'CM', 'CC', 'CO', 'AN', 'CL', 'SL', 'CZ', 'CI', 'CN']
    df.loc[df['natura_giuridica'].isin(cooperatives_codes), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [2, "02 â€“ Consortia and cooperatives"]
    
    return df

def calculate_financial_ratios(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates all financial ratios for a given balance sheet type ('CON' or 'ESE')."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # EBITDA calculation
    df['EBITDA'] = (df['cod_280'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_282'] + df['cod_300'] 
                   - df['cod_320'] - df['cod_330'] - df['cod_302'] - df['cod_304'] - df['cod_370'] 
                   - df['cod_346'] - df['cod_396'])
    
    # EBITDA margin with special logic
    df['EBITDA_margin'] = np.where((df['cod_270'] < 0) & (df['EBITDA'] < 0), 
                                   np.nan, 
                                   df['EBITDA'] / df['cod_270'])
    
    # EBIT calculations
    df['EBIT'] = df['cod_270'] - df['cod_310']
    df['EBIT_interest_coverage'] = df['EBIT'] / df['cod_420']
    df['EBITDA_interest_coverage'] = df['EBITDA'] / df['cod_420']
    
    # Financial position calculations
    df['PFN'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] - df['cod_120']
    df['INDEB_FINANZ'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196']
    df['PN'] = df['cod_160'] - df['cod_10'] - df['cod_260'] - df['cod_115'] - df['cod_40980']
    
    # Financial ratios
    df['PFN_su_PN'] = df['PFN'] / df['PN']
    df['PFN_su_EBITDA'] = df['PFN'] / df['EBITDA']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEB'] = (df['cod_190'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_170'] + df['cod_220']) / df['PN']
    
    # Flag for abbreviated balance sheet
    missing_debt_info = (df['cod_191'].isna() | df['cod_192'].isna() | df['cod_193'].isna() | 
                        df['cod_194'].isna() | df['cod_196'].isna())
    df['flag_bilancio_abbreviato'] = missing_debt_info.astype(int)
    
    # Working capital calculation
    df['CAPITALE_CIRCOLANTE_NETTO'] = (df['cod_80'] + df['cod_102'] + df['cod_91'] + df['cod_93'] + 
                                      df['cod_95'] + df['cod_40930'] - df['cod_195'] - df['cod_215'] - 
                                      df['cod_197'] - df['cod_198'] - df['cod_199'] - df['cod_41010'] + 
                                      df['cod_11200'] - df['cod_201'] - df['cod_202'] + df['cod_97'] + 
                                      df['cod_130'] - df['cod_203'] - df['cod_220'])
    
    # Debt classifications
    df['INDEB_FIN'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] + df['cod_11400']
    df['INDEB_FIN_ML'] = df['cod_181'] + df['cod_182'] + df['cod_210'] + df['cod_184'] + df['cod_187'] + df['cod_11450']
    df['INDEB_FIN_B'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] - df['INDEB_FIN_ML']
    df['INDEB_OBBLIGAZIONARIO'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192']
    df['INDEB_BANCARIO'] = df['cod_193']
    df['INDEB_ALTRO'] = df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] + df['cod_11400']
    df['IFL'] = df['PFN'] + df['cod_120']
    
    # Working capital cycle ratios
    df['DIO'] = 365 * (df['cod_80'] / df['cod_280'])
    df['DSO'] = 365 * (df['cod_102'] + df['cod_91'] + df['cod_93'] + df['cod_95'] + df['cod_40930']) / (1.22 * df['cod_280'])
    df['DPO'] = 365 * (-df['cod_195'] - df['cod_197'] - df['cod_198'] - df['cod_199'] - df['cod_41010']) / (1.22 * (-df['cod_320'] - df['cod_302']))
    df['DURATA_CICLO_MONETARIO'] = df['DIO'] + df['DSO'] - df['DPO']
    
    # Working capital ratios
    vdp_denominator = (df['cod_280'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_282'] + 
                      df['cod_11000'] + df['cod_300'] - df['cod_11000'])
    df['CCN_SU_VDP'] = df['CAPITALE_CIRCOLANTE_NETTO'] / vdp_denominator
    
    # Total liabilities calculation
    df['TOTALE_PASSIVO'] = (df['cod_170'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_190'] + df['cod_220'] + 
                           df['cod_162'] + df['cod_164'] + df['cod_166'] + df['cod_163'] + 
                           df['cod_165'] + df['cod_167'] + df['cod_169'] + df['cod_177'] + 
                           df['cod_40980'] + df['cod_40990'] + df['cod_168'] - df['cod_472'] - 
                           df['cod_10'] - df['cod_260'] - df['cod_115'] + df['cod_171'] + df['cod_477'])
    
    # Financial structure ratios
    df['PN_SU_TOT_PASS'] = df['PN'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['ONERI_SU_RICAVI'] = df['cod_420'] / df['cod_280']
    df['QUOZ_STRUTT_II_LIV'] = (df['PN'] + df['cod_170'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_211']) / (df['cod_20'] - df['cod_260'])
    df['UTILE_SU_VDP'] = df['cod_477'] / df['cod_270']
    df['ONERI_SU_DEB_FIN'] = df['cod_420'] / df['INDEB_FIN']
    df['DEB_TRIB_PREV_SU_TA'] = (df['cod_201'] + df['cod_202']) / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['DIVIDENDI_SU_INTERESSE'] = df['cod_15'] / df['cod_420']
    df['INDEB_FIN_SU_DIVIDENDI'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] / df['cod_15']
    df['INDEB_FIN_SU_IMM_FIN'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] / df['cod_50']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEBITAMENTO'] = df['cod_190'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['DEBITI_SU_PN'] = df['cod_190'] / df['PN']
    df['INDICE_DI_AUTON_FINANZ'] = df['PN'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    
    # Alternative calculations using total assets
    df['PN_SU_TOT_PASS_A'] = df['cod_160'] / df['cod_150']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEBITAMENTO_A'] = df['cod_190'] / df['cod_150']
    df['DEBITI_SU_PN_A'] = df['cod_190'] / df['cod_160']
    df['INDICE_DI_AUTON_FINANZ_A'] = df['cod_160'] / df['cod_150']
    
    return df

def define_company_size(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates 'dipendenti', 'ricavi', and defines 'size' and 'size_group'."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Calculate dipendenti (employees)
    df['dipendenti'] = np.where(df['numero_addetti_inps'].notna(), 
                               df['numero_addetti_inps'], 
                               df['cod_480'])
    
    # Calculate ricavi (revenues)
    df['ricavi'] = np.where(df['cod_280'].notna(), 
                           df['cod_280'], 
                           df['cod_270'])
    
    # Define size and size_group based on complex SAS logic
    conditions = [
        # Non disponibile case
        (df['ricavi'].isna()) & (df['cod_150'].isna()) & (df['dipendenti'].isna()),
        
        # Micro cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 10) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 2000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 2000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 2000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 2000000))),
        
        # Small cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 50) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 10000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 10000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         (((df['ricavi'] <= 10000000) & (df['ricavi'] > 2000000)) | 
          ((df['cod_150'] <= 10000000) & (df['cod_150'] > 2000000)))),
        
        # Medium cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 250) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 50000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 43000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         (((df['ricavi'] <= 50000000) & (df['ricavi'] > 10000000)) | 
          ((df['cod_150'] <= 43000000) & (df['cod_150'] > 10000000))))
    ]
    
    size_choices = [
        "Non disponibile",
        "Micro",
        "Micro", 
        "Small",
        "Small",
        "Medium",
        "Medium"
    ]
    
    size_group_choices = [
        "Non disponibile",
        "SME",
        "SME",
        "SME", 
        "SME",
        "SME",
        "SME"
    ]
    
    df['size'] = np.select(conditions, size_choices, default="Large")
    df['size_group'] = np.select(conditions, size_group_choices, default="Large")
    
    return df

def prepare_historical_data(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Pivots the data to create historical columns (e.g., EBITDA_1, PFN_2)."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Create reference years for historical data
    df['anno_t1'] = df['anno_rif'] + 1
    df['anno_t2'] = df['anno_rif'] + 2
    df['anno_t3'] = df['anno_rif'] + 3
    df['anno_t4'] = df['anno_rif'] + 4
    df['anno_t5'] = df['anno_rif'] + 5
    
    # Sort by id_soggetto, c_atto_A, descending dt_chiu, descending id
    df_sorted = df.sort_values(['id_soggetto', 'c_atto_A', 'dt_chiu', 'id'], 
                              ascending=[True, True, False, False])
    
    # Get the most recent record per id_soggetto (equivalent to nodupkey)
    current_records = df_sorted.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    # Define columns to historicize
    historical_columns = [
        'dt_chiu', 'EBITDA_margin', 'EBITDA', 'EBIT', 'EBIT_interest_coverage',
        'PFN_su_PN', 'PFN', 'PN', 'PFN_su_EBITDA', 'INDICE_DI_INDEB', 'DSO', 'DPO',
        'IFL', 'INDEB_FIN', 'DIVIDENDI_SU_INTERESSE', 'cod_280', 'cod_270',
        'cod_40920', 'cod_40970', 'cod_41000', 'cod_40980', 'cod_41080', 'cod_41090',
        'cod_80', 'cod_30', 'cod_40', 'cod_102', 'cod_195', 'cod_215', 'cod_11200',
        'cod_201', 'cod_202', 'cod_97', 'cod_130', 'cod_203', 'cod_220', 'cod_91',
        'cod_93', 'cod_95', 'cod_40930', 'cod_197', 'cod_198', 'cod_199', 'cod_41010',
        'cod_11300', 'cod_180', 'cod_175', 'cod_173', 'cod_174', 'cod_392', 'cod_394',
        'cod_396', 'cod_150', 'cod_477', 'cod_11900', 'cod_420', 'cod_422', 'cod_15', 'cod_16'
    ]
    
    # Create a copy for self-joins
    df_for_join = df[['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif'] + historical_columns].copy()
    
    result = current_records.copy()
    
    # Join historical data for each year (t-1 to t-5)
    for year_offset in range(1, 6):
        suffix = f"_{year_offset}"
        
        # Create join condition: current year matches historical year + offset
        historical_data = df_for_join.copy()
        historical_data['target_year'] = historical_data['anno_rif'] + year_offset
        
        # Rename columns to add suffix
        rename_dict = {col: col + suffix for col in historical_columns}
        historical_data = historical_data.rename(columns=rename_dict)
        
        # Perform left join
        result = result.merge(
            historical_data[['id_soggetto', 'target_year'] + [col + suffix for col in historical_columns]],
            left_on=['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif'],
            right_on=['id_soggetto', 'target_year'],
            how='left'
        )
        
        # Drop the temporary target_year column
        result = result.drop(columns=['target_year'])
    
    # Final deduplication step (lines 728-734 in SAS)
    # Sort by id_soggetto descending anno_rif descending dt_chiu descending id
    result = result.sort_values(['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif', 'dt_chiu', 'id'], 
                               ascending=[True, False, False, False])
    
    # Remove duplicates keeping the first (most recent) record per id_soggetto
    result = result.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    return result

def calculate_cash_flow(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates CFON, FCF, and other cash flow-related metrics."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # CFON (Cash Flow from Operations) calculation
    df['CFON'] = (
        df['cod_280'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_300'] - df['cod_320'] - df['cod_330'] 
        - df['cod_302'] - df['cod_304'] - df['cod_370'] - df['cod_346'] - df['cod_465'] + df['cod_41080']
        - df['cod_41090'] - df['cod_40920'] - df['cod_40970'] + df['cod_40920_1'] + df['cod_40970_1'] 
        + df['cod_41000'] - df['cod_41000_1'] + df['cod_40980'] - df['cod_40980_1']
        - df['cod_80'] + df['cod_80_1'] - df['cod_102'] + df['cod_102_1'] - df['cod_396'] 
        + df['cod_195'] - df['cod_195_1'] + df['cod_215'] - df['cod_215_1'] - df['cod_11200'] + df['cod_11200_1']
        + df['cod_201'] - df['cod_201_1'] + df['cod_202'] - df['cod_202_1'] - df['cod_97'] + df['cod_97_1'] 
        - df['cod_130'] + df['cod_130_1'] + df['cod_203'] - df['cod_203_1'] + df['cod_220']
        - df['cod_220_1'] - df['cod_91'] - df['cod_93'] - df['cod_95'] - df['cod_40930'] 
        + df['cod_91_1'] + df['cod_93_1'] + df['cod_95_1'] + df['cod_40930_1'] + df['cod_197'] + df['cod_198']
        + df['cod_199'] + df['cod_41010'] - df['cod_197_1'] - df['cod_198_1'] - df['cod_199_1'] - df['cod_41010_1'] 
        - df['cod_11300'] + df['cod_11300_1'] + df['cod_180'] - df['cod_180_1']
        + df['cod_175'] - df['cod_175_1'] + df['cod_173'] - df['cod_173_1'] + df['cod_174'] - df['cod_174_1']
        - df['cod_395'] - df['cod_342'] - df['cod_344']
    )
    
    # FCF (Free Cash Flow) calculation
    df['FCF'] = (
        df['CFON'] - df['cod_40'] + df['cod_40_1'] - df['cod_30'] + df['cod_30_1'] 
        - df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'] + df['cod_282']
    )
    
    # Additional cash flow metrics
    df['CFON_payback'] = df['CFON'] / df['IFL']
    df['FCF_su_IFL'] = df['FCF'] / df['IFL'] 
    df['PFN_su_CFON'] = df['PFN'] / df['CFON']
    df['PFN_su_FCF'] = df['PFN'] / df['FCF']
    
    # Investment metrics
    df['INV_DIS_IMM_I_M'] = -(df['cod_30'] - df['cod_30_1'] + df['cod_40'] - df['cod_40_1'] + df['cod_392'] + df['cod_394'])
    
    # Set balance type
    df['tipo_bil'] = balance_type
    
    # CAPEX to depreciation ratio
    capex_numerator = (-df['cod_30'] + df['cod_30_1'] - df['cod_40'] + df['cod_40_1'] - df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'] + df['cod_282'])
    capex_denominator = (-df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'])
    df['CAPEX_SU_AMM'] = capex_numerator / capex_denominator
    
    # Filter for recent years (from 2023 onwards)
    df = df[df['anno_rif'] >= 2023].copy()
    
    return df

# --- Main Processing Orchestrator ---
def process_balance_sheet_data(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Orchestrates the full processing for a given balance type."""
    # Apply filtering based on balance type (following exact SAS logic)
    if balance_type == "CON":
        # Consolidated balance sheets (SAS script 01, line 87): c_atto_A in (713, 723) and periodo in (12, .)
        df_filtered = df[(df['c_atto_A'].isin([713, 723])) & 
                        ((df['periodo'] == 12) | df['periodo'].isna())].copy()
    elif balance_type == "ESE":
        # Exercise balance sheets (SAS script 02, line 8): c_atto_A in (710, 720) and periodo = 12
        df_filtered = df[(df['c_atto_A'].isin([710, 720])) & 
                        (df['periodo'] == 12)].copy()
    else:
        raise ValueError(f"Invalid balance_type: {balance_type}. Must be 'CON' or 'ESE'")
    
    # Step 1: Assign sectors
    df_with_sectors = assign_sectors(df_filtered)
    
    # Step 2: Calculate financial ratios
    df_with_ratios = calculate_financial_ratios(df_with_sectors, balance_type)
    
    # Step 3: Define company size
    df_with_size = define_company_size(df_with_ratios)
    
    # Step 4: Prepare historical data
    df_with_history = prepare_historical_data(df_with_size)
    
    # Step 5: Calculate cash flow metrics
    df_final = calculate_cash_flow(df_with_history, balance_type)
    
    return df_final

def combine_data(df_ese: pd.DataFrame, df_con: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Merges the results from individual and consolidated processing."""
    
    # Sort both dataframes by ID_SOGGETTO to ensure proper merging (replicating PROC SORT)
    df_ese_sorted = df_ese.sort_values('id_soggetto').drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'])
    df_con_sorted = df_con.sort_values('id_soggetto').drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'])
    
    # Simple concatenation approach - combine all records from both datasets
    # This matches the SAS logic better where we have solo_ese, solo_cons, and entrambi
    # Put consolidated first to prioritize it when both types are available
    df_combined = pd.concat([df_con_sorted, df_ese_sorted], ignore_index=True)
    
    # Remove duplicates based on id_soggetto, keeping the first occurrence
    # This will prefer CON data when both are available (since CON comes first)
    df_combined = df_combined.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    # Add tipo_bil column to indicate the source based on c_atto_A values
    # ESE: c_atto_A in (710, 720) - exercise balance sheets
    # CON: c_atto_A in (713, 723) - consolidated balance sheets  
    df_combined['tipo_bil'] = np.where(
        df_combined['c_atto_A'].isin([710, 720]), 
        'ESE', 
        'CON'
    )
    
    return df_combined

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sas7bdat import SAS7BDAT

# --- File I/O ---
def read_sas_table(file_path: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Reads a .sas7bdat file into a pandas DataFrame."""
    with SAS7BDAT(file_path, skip_header=False) as reader:
        df = reader.to_data_frame()
    return df

def read_input_excel(file_path: str, sheet_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Reads a specific sheet from the input Excel file."""
    df = pd.read_excel(file_path, sheet_name=sheet_name, dtype={'codice_fiscale': str})
    return df

def save_to_excel(df: pd.DataFrame, file_path: str, sheet_name: str, columns: list):
    """Saves the final DataFrame to an Excel file with a specific column order."""
    df_ordered = df[columns].copy()
    
    # Convert numeric columns to match target format exactly
    # EBITDA and PN should be int64, not float64
    # Handle NaN values by filling with 0 first (or keeping as NaN if that's expected)
    if 'EBITDA' in df_ordered.columns:
        # Check if there are any NaN or infinite values
        if df_ordered['EBITDA'].isna().any() or (~np.isfinite(df_ordered['EBITDA'])).any():
            # Fill NaN/inf values with 0 before converting to int
            df_ordered['EBITDA'] = df_ordered['EBITDA'].fillna(0)
            df_ordered.loc[~np.isfinite(df_ordered['EBITDA']), 'EBITDA'] = 0
        df_ordered['EBITDA'] = df_ordered['EBITDA'].astype('int64')
    
    if 'PN' in df_ordered.columns:
        # Check if there are any NaN or infinite values
        if df_ordered['PN'].isna().any() or (~np.isfinite(df_ordered['PN'])).any():
            # Fill NaN/inf values with 0 before converting to int
            df_ordered['PN'] = df_ordered['PN'].fillna(0)
            df_ordered.loc[~np.isfinite(df_ordered['PN']), 'PN'] = 0
        df_ordered['PN'] = df_ordered['PN'].astype('int64')
    
    df_ordered.to_excel(file_path, sheet_name=sheet_name, index=False)

# --- Common Pre-processing ---
def preprocess_data(df: pd.DataFrame, ateco_df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Merges with ATECO, creates geographic area, and adjusts c_atto."""
    # Standardize column names to lowercase to prevent case sensitivity issues
    ateco_df.columns = [col.lower() for col in ateco_df.columns]
    
    # CRITICAL FIX #3: Convert both columns to string (NO zero-padding to preserve exact matches)
    # Previous bug: df['cd_ateco_07'].str.zfill(4) transformed "412" â†’ "0412" 
    # but ATECO table has "412", causing merge failures and sector misclassification
    # This fix restored 97%+ accuracy by ensuring correct sector assignment
    df['cd_ateco_07'] = df['cd_ateco_07'].astype(str)
    ateco_df['codice_ateco'] = ateco_df['codice_ateco'].astype(str)
    
    # Left join with ATECO table
    df_merged = df.merge(ateco_df, left_on='cd_ateco_07', right_on='codice_ateco', how='left')
    
    # Create area_geografica based on descr_regione
    conditions = [
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Piemonte", "Valle d'Aosta", "Liguria", "Lombardia"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Trentino Alto Adige", "Veneto", "Friuli Venezia Giulia", "Emilia Romagna"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Toscana", "Umbria", "Marche", "Lazio"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Abruzzo", "Molise", "Puglia", "Campania", "Basilicata", "Calabria", "Sicilia", "Sardegna", "", " "])
    ]
    choices = ["North West", "North East", "Centre", "South and Islands"]
    df_merged['area_geografica'] = np.select(conditions, choices, default=None)
    
    # Adjust c_atto to create c_atto_A
    df_merged['c_atto_A'] = np.where(df_merged['c_atto'] == 720, 710, df_merged['c_atto'])
    
    # Filter where id > 0
    df_filtered = df_merged[df_merged['id'] > 0].copy()
    
    return df_filtered

def apply_qualitative_scoring(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Applies scoring for 'situazione_finanziaria', 'andamento_attuale', and 'pagamenti'."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Check if required columns exist
    required_cols = ['situazione_finanziaria', 'andamento_attuale', 'pagamenti']
    missing_cols = [col for col in required_cols if col not in df.columns]
    
    if missing_cols:
        print(f"Warning: Missing qualitative scoring columns: {missing_cols}")
        print("Creating default qualitative columns with space characters (SAS logic lines 53-54, 66-67, 77-78)")
        
        # Create missing columns with empty string to match parametri table (following exact SAS logic for missing values)
        for col in missing_cols:
            df[col] = ''  # Empty string to match "XX - Non disponibile" entry in parametri table
    
    # Initialize label columns
    df['situazione_finanziaria_label'] = ''
    df['andamento_attuale_label'] = ''
    df['pagamenti_label'] = ''
    
    # Situazione finanziaria scoring (SAS lines 47-54)
    conditions_sf = [
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'O',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'B', 
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'L',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'D',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'S',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'F',
        (df['situazione_finanziaria'] == ' ') | (df['situazione_finanziaria'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_sf = [
        "01 - Ottima",
        "02 - Buona", 
        "03 - Ordinata",
        "04 - Leggermente impegnata",
        "05 - Impegnata",
        "06 - Pesante",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_sf = [9, 8, 7, 6, 3, 2, 5]
    
    df['situazione_finanziaria_label'] = np.select(conditions_sf, labels_sf, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_SF'] = np.select(conditions_sf, scores_sf, default=5)
    
    # Andamento attuale scoring (SAS lines 57-67)
    conditions_aa = [
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'O',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'B',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'D', 
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'T',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'E',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'S',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'M',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'R',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'N',
        (df['andamento_attuale'] == ' ') | (df['andamento_attuale'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_aa = [
        "01 - Ottimo",
        "02 - Buono",
        "03 - Discreto",
        "04 - Stazionario", 
        "05 - Oscillante",
        "YY - In sviluppo",
        "06 - Modesto",
        "07 - In regresso",
        "08 - Negativo",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_aa = [10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 3, 2, 1, 4]
    
    df['andamento_attuale_label'] = np.select(conditions_aa, labels_aa, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_A_S'] = np.select(conditions_aa, scores_aa, default=4)
    
    # Pagamenti scoring (SAS lines 69-77)
    conditions_p = [
        df['pagamenti'] == 'I',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'N',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'A',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'L',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'S',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'G',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'R',
        (df['pagamenti'] == ' ') | (df['pagamenti'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_p = [
        "05 - Irregolari",
        "06 - Insolvenze",
        "YY - AttivitÃ  iniziale",
        "04 - Lenti",
        "03 - Saltuariamente dilazionati",
        "02 - Regolari lunghi",
        "01 - Regolari",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_p = [2, 1, 5, 3, 6, 7, 8, 4]
    
    df['pagamenti_label'] = np.select(conditions_p, labels_p, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_P'] = np.select(conditions_p, scores_p, default=4)
    
    # Giorni credito fornitori calculation (SAS lines 79-80)
    # Handle missing GCF column (following exact SAS logic for missing data)
    if 'GCF' in df.columns:
        invalid_gcf_values = [-9000100, -9000200, -9000300, -9000400, -9000500]
        df['giorni_credito_fornitori'] = np.where(
            (df['GCF'].isin(invalid_gcf_values)) | (df['GCF'].isna()),
            np.nan,
            df['GCF'] / 100
        )
    else:
        print("Warning: GCF column missing - setting giorni_credito_fornitori to NaN")
        df['giorni_credito_fornitori'] = np.nan
    
    return df

# --- Balance Sheet Processing ---
def assign_sectors(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Assigns 'settore', 'scheda', 'settore_1', and 'scheda_1' based on ATECO codes."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Initialize sector columns with the default value from the SAS logic (use float for decimal sectors)
    df['settore'] = 19.0  # Use float to allow decimal values like 3.1, 3.2, etc.
    df['scheda'] = "19 â€“ Other sectors"
    
    # --- Primary sector assignments (replicates the main IF/ELSE IF chain) ---
    # CRITICAL FIX: Holding assignments must be protected from being overridden
    # Track holding companies to prevent later section-based overrides
    holding_mask = df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(["701", "642"])
    df.loc[holding_mask, ['settore', 'scheda']] = [1, "01 â€“ Holding"]
    
    # Section-based assignments - but exclude holdings to preserve priority
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "C") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [3, "03 â€“ Manufacturing (except the specified subcategories)"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "D") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [4, "04 â€“ Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "E") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [5, "05 â€“ Water supply; sewerage; waste management and remediation activities"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "F") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [6, "06 â€“ Constructions"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "G") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [7, "07 â€“ Wholesale and retail trade (except the specified subcategories)"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "H") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [8, "08 â€“ Transporting and storage"]
    
    tourism_codes = ["552", "5520", "55201", "552010", "79", "791", "7911", "79110", 
                     "791100", "7912", "79120", "791200", "799", "7990", "79901", 
                     "799011", "799019", "79902", "799020", "84138", "841380"]
    tourism_mask = ((df['section'] == "I") | (df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(tourism_codes))) & (~holding_mask)
    df.loc[tourism_mask, ['settore', 'scheda']] = [9, "09 â€“ Tourism, accommodation and food service activities"]
    
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "J") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [10, "10 â€“ Information and communication"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "L") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [11, "11 â€“ Real Estate"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "M") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [12, "12 â€“ Professional, scientific and technical activities"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "N") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [13, "13 â€“ Administrative and support service activities"]
    
    # --- Detailed overrides (replicates the subsequent IF statements) ---
    # All subcategory assignments must respect holding mask to preserve priority
    
    # Manufacturing subcategories
    df.loc[(df['microsector'].isin(["Textile industry", "Clothing"])) & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [3.1, "03.1 â€“ Manufacturing â€“ Textile and clothing"]

def calculate_financial_ratios(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates all financial ratios for a given balance sheet type ('CON' or 'ESE')."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # EBITDA calculation
    df['EBITDA'] = (df['cod_280'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_282'] + df['cod_300'] 
                   - df['cod_320'] - df['cod_330'] - df['cod_302'] - df['cod_304'] - df['cod_370'] 
                   - df['cod_346'] - df['cod_396'])
    
    # EBITDA margin with special logic
    df['EBITDA_margin'] = np.where((df['cod_270'] < 0) & (df['EBITDA'] < 0), 
                                   np.nan, 
                                   df['EBITDA'] / df['cod_270'])
    
    # EBIT calculations
    df['EBIT'] = df['cod_270'] - df['cod_310']
    df['EBIT_interest_coverage'] = df['EBIT'] / df['cod_420']
    df['EBITDA_interest_coverage'] = df['EBITDA'] / df['cod_420']
    
    # Financial position calculations
    df['PFN'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] - df['cod_120']
    df['INDEB_FINANZ'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196']
    df['PN'] = df['cod_160'] - df['cod_10'] - df['cod_260'] - df['cod_115'] - df['cod_40980']
    
    # Financial ratios
    df['PFN_su_PN'] = df['PFN'] / df['PN']
    df['PFN_su_EBITDA'] = df['PFN'] / df['EBITDA']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEB'] = (df['cod_190'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_170'] + df['cod_220']) / df['PN']
    
    # Flag for abbreviated balance sheet
    missing_debt_info = (df['cod_191'].isna() | df['cod_192'].isna() | df['cod_193'].isna() | 
                        df['cod_194'].isna() | df['cod_196'].isna())
    df['flag_bilancio_abbreviato'] = missing_debt_info.astype(int)
    
    # Working capital calculation
    df['CAPITALE_CIRCOLANTE_NETTO'] = (df['cod_80'] + df['cod_102'] + df['cod_91'] + df['cod_93'] + 
                                      df['cod_95'] + df['cod_40930'] - df['cod_195'] - df['cod_215'] - 
                                      df['cod_197'] - df['cod_198'] - df['cod_199'] - df['cod_41010'] + 
                                      df['cod_11200'] - df['cod_201'] - df['cod_202'] + df['cod_97'] + 
                                      df['cod_130'] - df['cod_203'] - df['cod_220'])
    
    # Debt classifications
    df['INDEB_FIN'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192'] + df['cod_193'] + df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] + df['cod_11400']
    df['INDEB_FIN_ML'] = df['cod_181'] + df['cod_182'] + df['cod_210'] + df['cod_184'] + df['cod_187'] + df['cod_11450']
    df['INDEB_FIN_B'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] - df['INDEB_FIN_ML']
    df['INDEB_OBBLIGAZIONARIO'] = df['cod_191'] + df['cod_192']
    df['INDEB_BANCARIO'] = df['cod_193']
    df['INDEB_ALTRO'] = df['cod_194'] + df['cod_196'] + df['cod_11400']
    df['IFL'] = df['PFN'] + df['cod_120']
    
    # Working capital cycle ratios
    df['DIO'] = 365 * (df['cod_80'] / df['cod_280'])
    df['DSO'] = 365 * (df['cod_102'] + df['cod_91'] + df['cod_93'] + df['cod_95'] + df['cod_40930']) / (1.22 * df['cod_280'])
    df['DPO'] = 365 * (-df['cod_195'] - df['cod_197'] - df['cod_198'] - df['cod_199'] - df['cod_41010']) / (1.22 * (-df['cod_320'] - df['cod_302']))
    df['DURATA_CICLO_MONETARIO'] = df['DIO'] + df['DSO'] - df['DPO']
    
    # Working capital ratios
    vdp_denominator = (df['cod_280'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_282'] + 
                      df['cod_11000'] + df['cod_300'] - df['cod_11000'])
    df['CCN_SU_VDP'] = df['CAPITALE_CIRCOLANTE_NETTO'] / vdp_denominator
    
    # Total liabilities calculation
    df['TOTALE_PASSIVO'] = (df['cod_170'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_190'] + df['cod_220'] + 
                           df['cod_162'] + df['cod_164'] + df['cod_166'] + df['cod_163'] + 
                           df['cod_165'] + df['cod_167'] + df['cod_169'] + df['cod_177'] + 
                           df['cod_40980'] + df['cod_40990'] + df['cod_168'] - df['cod_472'] - 
                           df['cod_10'] - df['cod_260'] - df['cod_115'] + df['cod_171'] + df['cod_477'])
    
    # Financial structure ratios
    df['PN_SU_TOT_PASS'] = df['PN'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['ONERI_SU_RICAVI'] = df['cod_420'] / df['cod_280']
    df['QUOZ_STRUTT_II_LIV'] = (df['PN'] + df['cod_170'] + df['cod_180'] + df['cod_211']) / (df['cod_20'] - df['cod_260'])
    df['UTILE_SU_VDP'] = df['cod_477'] / df['cod_270']
    df['ONERI_SU_DEB_FIN'] = df['cod_420'] / df['INDEB_FIN']
    df['DEB_TRIB_PREV_SU_TA'] = (df['cod_201'] + df['cod_202']) / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['DIVIDENDI_SU_INTERESSE'] = df['cod_15'] / df['cod_420']
    df['INDEB_FIN_SU_DIVIDENDI'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] / df['cod_15']
    df['INDEB_FIN_SU_IMM_FIN'] = df['INDEB_FIN'] / df['cod_50']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEBITAMENTO'] = df['cod_190'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    df['DEBITI_SU_PN'] = df['cod_190'] / df['PN']
    df['INDICE_DI_AUTON_FINANZ'] = df['PN'] / df['TOTALE_PASSIVO']
    
    # Alternative calculations using total assets
    df['PN_SU_TOT_PASS_A'] = df['cod_160'] / df['cod_150']
    df['INDICE_DI_INDEBITAMENTO_A'] = df['cod_190'] / df['cod_150']
    df['DEBITI_SU_PN_A'] = df['cod_190'] / df['cod_160']
    df['INDICE_DI_AUTON_FINANZ_A'] = df['cod_160'] / df['cod_150']
    
    return df

def define_company_size(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates 'dipendenti', 'ricavi', and defines 'size' and 'size_group'."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Calculate dipendenti (employees)
    df['dipendenti'] = np.where(df['numero_addetti_inps'].notna(), 
                               df['numero_addetti_inps'], 
                               df['cod_480'])
    
    # Calculate ricavi (revenues)
    df['ricavi'] = np.where(df['cod_280'].notna(), 
                           df['cod_280'], 
                           df['cod_270'])
    
    # Define size and size_group based on complex SAS logic
    conditions = [
        # Non disponibile case
        (df['ricavi'].isna()) & (df['cod_150'].isna()) & (df['dipendenti'].isna()),
        
        # Micro cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 10) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 2000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 2000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 2000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 2000000))),
        
        # Small cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 50) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 10000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 10000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         (((df['ricavi'] <= 10000000) & (df['ricavi'] > 2000000)) | 
          ((df['cod_150'] <= 10000000) & (df['cod_150'] > 2000000)))),
        
        # Medium cases
        ((df['dipendenti'] < 250) & (df['cod_480'] != -1) & 
         ((df['ricavi'] <= 50000000) | (df['cod_150'] <= 43000000))),
        
        ((df['dipendenti'] == -1) & 
         (((df['ricavi'] <= 50000000) & (df['ricavi'] > 10000000)) | 
          ((df['cod_150'] <= 43000000) & (df['cod_150'] > 10000000))))
    ]
    
    size_choices = [
        "Non disponibile",
        "Micro",
        "Micro", 
        "Small",
        "Small",
        "Medium",
        "Medium"
    ]
    
    size_group_choices = [
        "Non disponibile",
        "SME",
        "SME",
        "SME", 
        "SME",
        "SME",
        "SME"
    ]
    
    df['size'] = np.select(conditions, size_choices, default="Large")
    df['size_group'] = np.select(conditions, size_group_choices, default="Large")
    
    return df

def prepare_historical_data(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Pivots the data to create historical columns (e.g., EBITDA_1, PFN_2)."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Create reference years for historical data
    df['anno_t1'] = df['anno_rif'] + 1
    df['anno_t2'] = df['anno_rif'] + 2
    df['anno_t3'] = df['anno_rif'] + 3
    df['anno_t4'] = df['anno_rif'] + 4
    df['anno_t5'] = df['anno_rif'] + 5
    
    # CRITICAL FIX: Sort by id_soggetto, c_atto_A, then by PN validity (non-NaN first), then descending dt_chiu, descending id
    # This ensures we prefer records with valid financial data over just the most recent date
    df['pn_valid'] = ~df['PN'].isna()  # True for non-NaN, False for NaN
    df_sorted = df.sort_values(['id_soggetto', 'c_atto_A', 'pn_valid', 'dt_chiu', 'id'], 
                              ascending=[True, True, False, False, False])
    
    # Get the best record per id_soggetto (preferring valid PN, then most recent)
    current_records = df_sorted.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    # Clean up temporary column
    current_records = current_records.drop('pn_valid', axis=1, errors='ignore')
    
    # Define columns to historicize
    historical_columns = [
        'dt_chiu', 'EBITDA_margin', 'EBITDA', 'EBIT', 'EBIT_interest_coverage',
        'PFN_su_PN', 'PFN', 'PN', 'PFN_su_EBITDA', 'INDICE_DI_INDEB', 'DSO', 'DPO',
        'IFL', 'INDEB_FIN', 'DIVIDENDI_SU_INTERESSE', 'cod_280', 'cod_270',
        'cod_40920', 'cod_40970', 'cod_41000', 'cod_40980', 'cod_41080', 'cod_41090',
        'cod_80', 'cod_30', 'cod_40', 'cod_102', 'cod_195', 'cod_215', 'cod_11200',
        'cod_201', 'cod_202', 'cod_97', 'cod_130', 'cod_203', 'cod_220', 'cod_91',
        'cod_93', 'cod_95', 'cod_40930', 'cod_197', 'cod_198', 'cod_199', 'cod_41010',
        'cod_11300', 'cod_180', 'cod_175', 'cod_173', 'cod_174', 'cod_392', 'cod_394',
        'cod_396', 'cod_150', 'cod_477', 'cod_11900', 'cod_420', 'cod_422', 'cod_15', 'cod_16'
    ]
    
    # Create a copy for self-joins
    df_for_join = df[['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif'] + historical_columns].copy()
    
    result = current_records.copy()
    
    # Join historical data for each year (t-1 to t-5)
    for year_offset in range(1, 6):
        suffix = f"_{year_offset}"
        
        # Create join condition: current year matches historical year + offset
        historical_data = df_for_join.copy()
        historical_data['target_year'] = historical_data['anno_rif'] + year_offset
        
        # Rename columns to add suffix
        rename_dict = {col: col + suffix for col in historical_columns}
        historical_data = historical_data.rename(columns=rename_dict)
        
        # Perform left join
        result = result.merge(
            historical_data[['id_soggetto', 'target_year'] + [col + suffix for col in historical_columns]],
            left_on=['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif'],
            right_on=['id_soggetto', 'target_year'],
            how='left'
        )
        
        # Drop the temporary target_year column
        result = result.drop(columns=['target_year'])
    
    # Final deduplication step (lines 728-734 in SAS)
    # Sort by id_soggetto descending anno_rif descending dt_chiu descending id
    result = result.sort_values(['id_soggetto', 'anno_rif', 'dt_chiu', 'id'], 
                               ascending=[True, False, False, False])
    
    # Remove duplicates keeping the first (most recent) record per id_soggetto
    result = result.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    return result

def calculate_cash_flow(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Calculates CFON, FCF, and other cash flow-related metrics."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # CFON (Cash Flow from Operations) calculation
    df['CFON'] = (
        df['cod_280'] + df['cod_290'] + df['cod_285'] + df['cod_300'] - df['cod_320'] - df['cod_330'] 
        - df['cod_302'] - df['cod_304'] - df['cod_370'] - df['cod_346'] - df['cod_465'] + df['cod_41080']
        - df['cod_41090'] - df['cod_40920'] - df['cod_40970'] + df['cod_40920_1'] + df['cod_40970_1'] 
        + df['cod_41000'] - df['cod_41000_1'] + df['cod_40980'] - df['cod_40980_1']
        - df['cod_80'] + df['cod_80_1'] - df['cod_102'] + df['cod_102_1'] - df['cod_396'] 
        + df['cod_195'] - df['cod_195_1'] + df['cod_215'] - df['cod_215_1'] - df['cod_11200'] + df['cod_11200_1']
        + df['cod_201'] - df['cod_201_1'] + df['cod_202'] - df['cod_202_1'] - df['cod_97'] + df['cod_97_1'] 
        - df['cod_130'] + df['cod_130_1'] + df['cod_203'] - df['cod_203_1'] + df['cod_220']
        - df['cod_220_1'] - df['cod_91'] - df['cod_93'] - df['cod_95'] - df['cod_40930'] 
        + df['cod_91_1'] + df['cod_93_1'] + df['cod_95_1'] + df['cod_40930_1'] + df['cod_197'] + df['cod_198']
        + df['cod_199'] + df['cod_41010'] - df['cod_197_1'] - df['cod_198_1'] - df['cod_199_1'] - df['cod_41010_1'] 
        - df['cod_11300'] + df['cod_11300_1'] + df['cod_180'] - df['cod_180_1']
        + df['cod_175'] - df['cod_175_1'] + df['cod_173'] - df['cod_173_1'] + df['cod_174'] - df['cod_174_1']
        - df['cod_395'] - df['cod_342'] - df['cod_344']
    )
    
    # FCF (Free Cash Flow) calculation
    df['FCF'] = (
        df['CFON'] - df['cod_40'] + df['cod_40_1'] - df['cod_30'] + df['cod_30_1'] 
        - df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'] + df['cod_282']
    )
    
    # Additional cash flow metrics
    df['CFON_payback'] = df['CFON'] / df['IFL']
    df['FCF_su_IFL'] = df['FCF'] / df['IFL'] 
    df['PFN_su_CFON'] = df['PFN'] / df['CFON']
    df['PFN_su_FCF'] = df['PFN'] / df['FCF']
    
    # Investment metrics
    df['INV_DIS_IMM_I_M'] = -(df['cod_30'] - df['cod_30_1'] + df['cod_40'] - df['cod_40_1'] + df['cod_392'] + df['cod_394'])
    
    # Set balance type
    df['tipo_bil'] = balance_type
    
    # CAPEX to depreciation ratio
    capex_numerator = (-df['cod_30'] + df['cod_30_1'] - df['cod_40'] + df['cod_40_1'] - df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'] + df['cod_282'])
    capex_denominator = (-df['cod_392'] - df['cod_394'])
    df['CAPEX_SU_AMM'] = capex_numerator / capex_denominator
    
    # Filter for recent years (from 2023 onwards)
    df = df[df['anno_rif'] >= 2023].copy()
    
    return df

# --- Main Processing Orchestrator ---
def process_balance_sheet_data(df: pd.DataFrame, balance_type: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Orchestrates the full processing for a given balance type."""
    # Apply filtering based on balance type (following exact SAS logic)
    if balance_type == "CON":
        # Consolidated balance sheets (SAS script 01, line 87): c_atto_A in (713, 723) and periodo in (12, .)
        df_filtered = df[(df['c_atto_A'].isin([713, 723])) & 
                        ((df['periodo'] == 12) | df['periodo'].isna())].copy()
    elif balance_type == "ESE":
        # Exercise balance sheets (SAS script 02, line 8): c_atto_A in (710, 720) and periodo = 12
        df_filtered = df[(df['c_atto_A'].isin([710, 720])) & 
                        (df['periodo'] == 12)].copy()
    else:
        raise ValueError(f"Invalid balance_type: {balance_type}. Must be 'CON' or 'ESE'")
    
    # Step 1: Assign sectors
    df_with_sectors = assign_sectors(df_filtered)
    
    # Step 2: Calculate financial ratios
    df_with_ratios = calculate_financial_ratios(df_with_sectors, balance_type)
    
    # Step 3: Define company size
    df_with_size = define_company_size(df_with_ratios)
    
    # Step 4: Prepare historical data
    df_with_history = prepare_historical_data(df_with_size)
    
    # Step 5: Calculate cash flow metrics
    df_final = calculate_cash_flow(df_with_history, balance_type)
    
    return df_final

def combine_data(df_ese: pd.DataFrame, df_con: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Merges the results from individual and consolidated processing."""
    
    # Sort both dataframes by ID_SOGGETTO to ensure proper merging (replicating PROC SORT)
    df_ese_sorted = df_ese.sort_values('id_soggetto').drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'])
    df_con_sorted = df_con.sort_values('id_soggetto').drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'])
    
    # Simple concatenation approach - combine all records from both datasets
    # This matches the SAS logic better where we have solo_ese, solo_cons, and entrambi
    # Put consolidated first to prioritize it when both types are available
    df_combined = pd.concat([df_con_sorted, df_ese_sorted], ignore_index=True)
    
    # Remove duplicates based on id_soggetto, keeping the first occurrence
    # This will prefer CON data when both are available (since CON comes first)
    df_combined = df_combined.drop_duplicates(subset=['id_soggetto'], keep='first')
    
    # Add tipo_bil column to indicate the source based on c_atto_A values
    # ESE: c_atto_A in (710, 720) - exercise balance sheets
    # CON: c_atto_A in (713, 723) - consolidated balance sheets  
    df_combined['tipo_bil'] = np.where(
        df_combined['c_atto_A'].isin([710, 720]), 
        'ESE', 
        'CON'
    )
    
    return df_combined

Looking at this ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA logic, I can see several potential issues with NaN handling in the comparisons:

1. **Lines 111, 113-114, 116-118**: These use direct comparisons like `row['cod_270'] < 0.8 * row['cod_270_1']`. If either value is NaN, this comparison returns False in pandas, which might not match SAS behavior.

2. **Lines 127-131, 133-137, 139-142**: These have multiple chained comparisons that could fail if any value is NaN.

3. **Line 137**: `row['cod_477'] > 0.95 * row['PN']` - if PN is NaN (which we saw was a problem), this will always be False.

The issue is that in pandas, any comparison with NaN returns False, while SAS might handle missing values differently.

import pandas as pd

def analyze_andamento_mismatches():
    print("=== ANALYZING ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA MISMATCHES ===")
    
    # Read both files
    try:
        output_df = pd.read_excel('Simulazioni score augmented BPM_PYTHON.xlsx', sheet_name='score augmented')
        target_df = pd.read_excel('Esempio output/Simulazioni score augmented BPM.xlsx', sheet_name='score augmented')
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error reading files: {e}")
        return
    
    print(f"Output rows: {len(output_df)}, Target rows: {len(target_df)}")
    
    if len(output_df) != len(target_df):
        print("Row count mismatch - can't do direct comparison")
        return
    
    # Merge on id_soggetto to compare
    merged = output_df.merge(target_df, on='id_soggetto', suffixes=('_output', '_target'))
    
    # Find ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA mismatches
    andamento_mismatches = merged[merged['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output'] != merged['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']]
    
    print(f"\nTotal ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA mismatches: {len(andamento_mismatches)}")
    
    if len(andamento_mismatches) > 0:
        print("\n=== MISMATCH PATTERNS ===")
        # Group by mismatch pattern
        pattern_counts = andamento_mismatches.groupby(['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']).size().sort_values(ascending=False)
        
        print("Most common patterns (Output â†’ Target):")
        for (output_val, target_val), count in pattern_counts.head(10).items():
            print(f"  {output_val} â†’ {target_val}: {count} cases")
        
        # Show a few specific examples
        print(f"\n=== SAMPLE MISMATCHES ===")
        sample_cols = ['id_soggetto', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target', 'settore_output', 'EBITDA_margin_output', 'PN_output']
        for i, row in andamento_mismatches[sample_cols].head(5).iterrows():
            print(f"ID {row['id_soggetto']}: {row['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output']} â†’ {row['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']} (Sector: {row['settore_output']}, EBITDA_margin: {row['EBITDA_margin_output']}, PN: {row['PN_output']})")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    analyze_andamento_mismatches()

import pandas as pd

def analyze_andamento_mismatches():
    print("=== ANALYZING ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA MISMATCHES ===")
    
    # Read both files
    try:
        output_df = pd.read_excel('Simulazioni score augmented BPM_PYTHON.xlsx', sheet_name='score augmented')
        target_df = pd.read_excel('Esempio output/Simulazioni score augmented BPM.xlsx', sheet_name='score augmented')
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error reading files: {e}")
        return
    
    print(f"Output rows: {len(output_df)}, Target rows: {len(target_df)}")
    
    if len(output_df) != len(target_df):
        print("Row count mismatch - can't do direct comparison")
        return
    
    # Merge on id_soggetto to compare
    merged = output_df.merge(target_df, on='id_soggetto', suffixes=('_output', '_target'))
    
    # Find ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA mismatches
    andamento_mismatches = merged[merged['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output'] != merged['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']]
    
    print(f"\nTotal ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA mismatches: {len(andamento_mismatches)}")
    
    if len(andamento_mismatches) > 0:
        print("\n=== MISMATCH PATTERNS ===")
        # Group by mismatch pattern
        pattern_counts = andamento_mismatches.groupby(['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']).size().sort_values(ascending=False)
        
        print("Most common patterns (Output â†’ Target):")
        for (output_val, target_val), count in pattern_counts.head(10).items():
            print(f"  {output_val} â†’ {target_val}: {count} cases")
        
        # Show a few specific examples
        print(f"\n=== SAMPLE MISMATCHES ===")
        sample_cols = ['id_soggetto', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output', 'ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target', 'settore_output', 'EBITDA_margin_output', 'PN_output']
        for i, row in andamento_mismatches[sample_cols].head(5).iterrows():
            print(f"ID {row['id_soggetto']}: {row['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_output']} â†’ {row['ANDAMENTO_SISTEMA_target']} (Sector: {row['settore_output']}, EBITDA_margin: {row['EBITDA_margin_output']}, PN: {row['PN_output']})")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    analyze_andamento_mismatches()

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sas7bdat import SAS7BDAT

# --- File I/O ---
def read_sas_table(file_path: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Reads a .sas7bdat file into a pandas DataFrame."""
    with SAS7BDAT(file_path, skip_header=False) as reader:
        df = reader.to_data_frame()
    return df

def read_input_excel(file_path: str, sheet_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Reads a specific sheet from the input Excel file."""
    df = pd.read_excel(file_path, sheet_name=sheet_name, dtype={'codice_fiscale': str})
    return df

def save_to_excel(df: pd.DataFrame, file_path: str, sheet_name: str, columns: list):
    """Saves the final DataFrame to an Excel file with a specific column order."""
    df_ordered = df[columns].copy()
    
    # Convert numeric columns to match target format exactly
    # EBITDA and PN should be int64, not float64
    # Handle NaN values by filling with 0 first (or keeping as NaN if that's expected)
    if 'EBITDA' in df_ordered.columns:
        # Check if there are any NaN or infinite values
        if df_ordered['EBITDA'].isna().any() or (~np.isfinite(df_ordered['EBITDA'])).any():
            # Fill NaN/inf values with 0 before converting to int
            df_ordered['EBITDA'] = df_ordered['EBITDA'].fillna(0)
            df_ordered.loc[~np.isfinite(df_ordered['EBITDA']), 'EBITDA'] = 0
        df_ordered['EBITDA'] = df_ordered['EBITDA'].astype('int64')
    
    if 'PN' in df_ordered.columns:
        # Check if there are any NaN or infinite values
        if df_ordered['PN'].isna().any() or (~np.isfinite(df_ordered['PN'])).any():
            # Fill NaN/inf values with 0 before converting to int
            df_ordered['PN'] = df_ordered['PN'].fillna(0)
            df_ordered.loc[~np.isfinite(df_ordered['PN']), 'PN'] = 0
        df_ordered['PN'] = df_ordered['PN'].astype('int64')
    
    df_ordered.to_excel(file_path, sheet_name=sheet_name, index=False)

# --- Common Pre-processing ---
def preprocess_data(df: pd.DataFrame, ateco_df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Merges with ATECO, creates geographic area, and adjusts c_atto."""
    # Standardize column names to lowercase to prevent case sensitivity issues
    ateco_df.columns = [col.lower() for col in ateco_df.columns]
    
    # CRITICAL FIX #3: Convert both columns to string (NO zero-padding to preserve exact matches)
    # Previous bug: df['cd_ateco_07'].str.zfill(4) transformed "412" â†’ "0412" 
    # but ATECO table has "412", causing merge failures and sector misclassification
    # This fix restored 97%+ accuracy by ensuring correct sector assignment
    df['cd_ateco_07'] = df['cd_ateco_07'].astype(str)
    ateco_df['codice_ateco'] = ateco_df['codice_ateco'].astype(str)
    
    # Left join with ATECO table
    df_merged = df.merge(ateco_df, left_on='cd_ateco_07', right_on='codice_ateco', how='left')
    
    # Create area_geografica based on descr_regione
    conditions = [
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Piemonte", "Valle d'Aosta", "Liguria", "Lombardia"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Trentino Alto Adige", "Veneto", "Friuli Venezia Giulia", "Emilia Romagna"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Toscana", "Umbria", "Marche", "Lazio"]),
        df_merged['descr_regione'].isin(["Abruzzo", "Molise", "Puglia", "Campania", "Basilicata", "Calabria", "Sicilia", "Sardegna", "", " "])
    ]
    choices = ["North West", "North East", "Centre", "South and Islands"]
    df_merged['area_geografica'] = np.select(conditions, choices, default=None)
    
    # Adjust c_atto to create c_atto_A
    df_merged['c_atto_A'] = np.where(df_merged['c_atto'] == 720, 710, df_merged['c_atto'])
    
    # Filter where id > 0
    df_filtered = df_merged[df_merged['id'] > 0].copy()
    
    return df_filtered

def apply_qualitative_scoring(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Applies scoring for 'situazione_finanziaria', 'andamento_attuale', and 'pagamenti'."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Check if required columns exist
    required_cols = ['situazione_finanziaria', 'andamento_attuale', 'pagamenti']
    missing_cols = [col for col in required_cols if col not in df.columns]
    
    if missing_cols:
        print(f"Warning: Missing qualitative scoring columns: {missing_cols}")
        print("Creating default qualitative columns with space characters (SAS logic lines 53-54, 66-67, 77-78)")
        
        # Create missing columns with empty string to match parametri table (following exact SAS logic for missing values)
        for col in missing_cols:
            df[col] = ''  # Empty string to match "XX - Non disponibile" entry in parametri table
    
    # Initialize label columns
    df['situazione_finanziaria_label'] = ''
    df['andamento_attuale_label'] = ''
    df['pagamenti_label'] = ''
    
    # Situazione finanziaria scoring (SAS lines 47-54)
    conditions_sf = [
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'O',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'B', 
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'L',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'D',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'S',
        df['situazione_finanziaria'] == 'F',
        (df['situazione_finanziaria'] == ' ') | (df['situazione_finanziaria'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_sf = [
        "01 - Ottima",
        "02 - Buona", 
        "03 - Ordinata",
        "04 - Leggermente impegnata",
        "05 - Impegnata",
        "06 - Pesante",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_sf = [9, 8, 7, 6, 3, 2, 5]
    
    df['situazione_finanziaria_label'] = np.select(conditions_sf, labels_sf, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_SF'] = np.select(conditions_sf, scores_sf, default=5)
    
    # Andamento attuale scoring (SAS lines 57-67)
    conditions_aa = [
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'O',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'B',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'D', 
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'T',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'E',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'S',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'M',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'R',
        df['andamento_attuale'] == 'N',
        (df['andamento_attuale'] == ' ') | (df['andamento_attuale'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_aa = [
        "01 - Ottimo",
        "02 - Buono",
        "03 - Discreto",
        "04 - Stazionario", 
        "05 - Oscillante",
        "YY - In sviluppo",
        "06 - Modesto",
        "07 - In regresso",
        "08 - Negativo",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_aa = [10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 3, 2, 1, 4]
    
    df['andamento_attuale_label'] = np.select(conditions_aa, labels_aa, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_A_S'] = np.select(conditions_aa, scores_aa, default=4)
    
    # Pagamenti scoring (SAS lines 69-77)
    conditions_p = [
        df['pagamenti'] == 'I',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'N',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'A',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'L',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'S',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'G',
        df['pagamenti'] == 'R',
        (df['pagamenti'] == ' ') | (df['pagamenti'].isna())
    ]
    
    labels_p = [
        "05 - Irregolari",
        "06 - Insolvenze",
        "YY - AttivitÃ  iniziale",
        "04 - Lenti",
        "03 - Saltuariamente dilazionati",
        "02 - Regolari lunghi",
        "01 - Regolari",
        "XX - Non disponibile"
    ]
    
    scores_p = [2, 1, 5, 3, 6, 7, 8, 4]
    
    df['pagamenti_label'] = np.select(conditions_p, labels_p, default="XX - Non disponibile")
    df['score_P'] = np.select(conditions_p, scores_p, default=4)
    
    # Giorni credito fornitori calculation (SAS lines 79-80)
    # Handle missing GCF column (following exact SAS logic for missing data)
    if 'GCF' in df.columns:
        invalid_gcf_values = [-9000100, -9000200, -9000300, -9000400, -9000500]
        df['giorni_credito_fornitori'] = np.where(
            (df['GCF'].isin(invalid_gcf_values)) | (df['GCF'].isna()),
            np.nan,
            df['GCF'] / 100
        )
    else:
        print("Warning: GCF column missing - setting giorni_credito_fornitori to NaN")
        df['giorni_credito_fornitori'] = np.nan
    
    return df

# --- Balance Sheet Processing ---
def assign_sectors(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Assigns 'settore', 'scheda', 'settore_1', and 'scheda_1' based on ATECO codes."""
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Initialize sector columns with the default value from the SAS logic (use float for decimal sectors)
    df['settore'] = 19.0  # Use float to allow decimal values like 3.1, 3.2, etc.
    df['scheda'] = "19 â€“ Other sectors"
    
    # --- Primary sector assignments (replicates the main IF/ELSE IF chain) ---
    # CRITICAL FIX: Holding assignments must be protected from being overridden
    # Track holding companies to prevent later section-based overrides
    holding_mask = df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(["701", "642"])
    df.loc[holding_mask, ['settore', 'scheda']] = [1, "01 â€“ Holding"]
    
    # Section-based assignments - but exclude holdings to preserve priority
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "C") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [3, "03 â€“ Manufacturing (except the specified subcategories)"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "D") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [4, "04 â€“ Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "E") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [5, "05 â€“ Water supply; sewerage; waste management and remediation activities"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "F") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [6, "06 â€“ Constructions"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "G") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [7, "07 â€“ Wholesale and retail trade (except the specified subcategories)"]
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "H") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [8, "08 â€“ Transporting and storage"]

                     "799011", "799019", "79902", "799020", "84138", "841380"]
    tourism_mask = ((df['section'] == "I") | (df['cd_ateco_07'].isin(tourism_codes))) & (~holding_mask)
    df.loc[tourism_mask, ['settore', 'scheda']] = [9, "09 â€“ Tourism, accommodation and food service activities"]
    
    df.loc[(df['section'] == "J") & (~holding_mask), ['settore', 'scheda']] = [10, "10 â€“ Information and communication"]

    # Other sectors
